channel.title: iDigital
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from iDigital, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: My husband plans to leave his entire estate to his adult son, who steals his credit card to gamble online. What can I do?
item.description: “Dementia runs in my husband’s family. My husband’s son has been known to take money from his dad without permission.”

item.title: Ainos and ugo develop service robots with a sense of smell
item.description: Ainos and ugo say their integration of accurate volatile organic compound detection with robotics will help multiple industries. The post Ainos and ug...

item.title: ABB plans to invest $120M to expand production capacity in the U.S.
item.description: In the past three years, ABB has invested more than $500 million in its U.S. business, including a new $100 million facility in Wisconsin. The post AB...

item.title: AI reasoning models can cheat to win chess games
item.description: Facing defeat in chess, the latest generation of AI reasoning models sometimes cheat without being instructed to do so. The finding suggests that the ...

item.title: How Yelp reviewed competing LLMs for correctness, relevance and tone to develop its user-friendly AI assistant
item.description: Yelp found that when it first launched a GPT-4o-powered AI chatbot, usage rates dropped. But training it to sound like a human changed that.

item.title: Investors are anxious about Trump’s tariffs. Here’s what financial advisers are telling them to do.
item.description: Uncertainty surrounding tariff policy has rattled markets, and volatility is the highest it’s been all year.

item.title: Infinite Realms turns fantasy books into living, breathing game worlds with help of AI
item.description: Infinite Realms wants to turn beloved fantasy books with big followings into living, breathing game worlds.

item.title: Mayo Clinic’s secret weapon against AI hallucinations: Reverse RAG in action
item.description: To tackle data-retrieval-based hallucinations in non-diagnostic use cases, Mayo Clinic has applied CURE reverse RAG paired with vector databases.

item.title: I fled our $2.2M home due to domestic abuse. I’m on the loan, but we’re both on the title. My husband won’t sell. What now?
item.description: “He contributed a $1 million down payment. I mortgaged the rest in my name.”
